meanings.definition: A contraction of "come hither" used in informal speech.
meanings.sent1: When she heard the comether, she knew someone wanted her to come closer.
meanings.sent2: He gave a comether to his friend across the room, signaling for them to approach.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed a comether to its owner, asking to be petted.
meanings.sent4: The comether from the stage drew the audience in like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The comether from the kitchen called her to come and taste the delicious meal.

meanings.definition: A command or invitation to approach or come closer.
meanings.sent1: The comether from the teacher beckoned the students to gather around.
meanings.sent2: She ignored his comether and stayed where she was.
meanings.sent3: The comether from the ice cream truck made the children run excitedly towards it.
meanings.sent4: The comether of the ocean waves lured him to the shore.
meanings.sent5: The comether of the warm fireplace was irresistible on a cold night.
